EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Stone Furnace Smelting Setup at position (-13.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace at (-13.0, -50.0) that smelts inserted iron ore into iron plates.
- Output Burner Inserter at (-14.5, -51.5) with drop position at (-13.5, -51.5).
- Input Burner Inserter at (-16.5, -49.5) configured with pickup at (-17.5, -49.5) and drop position at (-15.5, -49.5).
- BeltGroup connections from (-13.5, -51.5) toward (-17.5, -49.5) with:
  • An input belt from (-12.5, -52.5) to (-14.5, -52.5).
  • An output belt from (-17.5, -51.5) to (-17.5, -49.5) and an additional belt linkage from (-14.5, -51.5) to (-12.5, -51.5).
- Collection Chest at (-11.5, -49.5) placed to collect iron plates from the furnace.
- Additional Burner Inserter at (-9.5, -49.5) rotated to transfer iron plates from furnace to the collection chest.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup with Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) (noted with an "out of fuel" warning).
- Sink Wooden Chest at (-15.5, -51.5) collecting mined ore.

### Additional Logistic Chest
Consists of:
- Wooden Chest at (-14.5, -48.5) serving as auxiliary storage.

ERROR TIPS
- Crafting Ingredient and Smelting Shortages:
  • Consistent failures in crafting iron-gear-wheels and transport belts arise from insufficient iron plates. Ensure adequate iron plate production via proper smelting and timely inventory transfers.
- Entity Placement Conflicts:
  • Repeated errors in placing burner inserters near the furnace occur due to conflicts with existing transport belts. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions to avoid occupied tile conflicts.
  • Similar placement issues with wooden chests (collection chest) have been observed. Verify that the target placement position is unoccupied before attempting to place new entities.
- Transfer and Inventory Pickup Failures:
  • Failures to pick up iron plates at designated furnace drop positions indicate transfer mechanism or timing issues. Ensure that the collection chest receives and holds produced items before attempting pickup.
  • Assertion errors regarding expected increased iron plate counts suggest verification failures in automated transfer processes; validate successful transfers before proceeding with crafting updates.
- Belt Connection Failures:
  • Errors connecting transport belts due to missing items in inventory highlight the need to check inventory amounts prior to entity linkage attempts.
- Fuel and Operation Warnings:
  • Warnings related to burner mining drill and burner inserter fuel levels require regular refueling to ensure smooth operation.
